content.description:
IMAGE 1: SUGARCANE HARVEST IN KARNATAKA, INDIA

IMAGE 2: SUGARCANE HARVEST IN QUEENSLAND, AUSTRALIA

Source: Pixabay

Sugarcane was originally domesticated in Southeast Asia and is now grown commercially in many parts of the world.
content.question:
A. Compare how the methods of sugarcane production shown in Image 1 and Image 2 differ in terms of their labor inputs.

B. Explain how the process of colonialism contributed to the diffusion of sugarcane from its hearth of domestication.

C. Explain how the type of sugarcane production shown in Image 2 may contribute to water pollution.

D. Explain how increased access to education for women is likely to affect women’s roles in agriculture within a developing country.

E. Explain how political relationships between countries may affect a country that exports sugarcane.
